values.help: Flush 2 relays module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.
values.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF

items.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

values.help: When Q1 relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an ON command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15
values.label: Turn off Q1 after set time

values.help: When Q1 relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an OFF command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15
values.label: Turn on Q1 after set time

values.help: When Q2 relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an ON command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15
values.label: Turning off Q2 after set time

values.help: When Q2 relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an OFF command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15
values.label: Turning on Q2 after set time

values.help: Select the time units for auto on/off configuration. Applies tot he whole device
values.label: Turning on/off s or ms selection
Saving the state of the 2 relays after a power failure

items.label: Flush 2 relays module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush 2 relays module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position.

values.help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0%- 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 1
values.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1

values.help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0%- 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 1
values.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q2

values.help: Set value means time interval (0 1 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1 second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)
values.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1

values.help: Set value means time interval (0 1 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1 second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)
values.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q2

values.help: Type of device that is connected to the output (NC or NO)
values.label: Output Q1 switch selection

items.label: When the switch is turned off the output is 0V (NC)
When the switch is turned off the output is 230V or 24V (NO)

values.help: Type of device that is connected to the output (NC or NO)
values.label: Output Q2 switch selection

items.label: When the switch is turned off the output is 0V (NC)
When the switch is turned off the output is 230V or 24V (NO)

values.help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. Available configuration parameters : default value 32536. 32536  offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 = value from 0.1C to 10.0C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 = value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.
values.label: Temperature sensor offset settings

values.help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters : 0 = reporting disabled. 1 to 127 = 0,1C to 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value is 5 = 0,5C
values.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
